summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing dated April 23, 2021, summarizing major news stories across various categories including Capitol violence investigations, criminal cases, COVID-19, climate policy, and international affairs. It is a daily intelligence digest for the FBI Director and senior staff, covering a wide range of topics with no single focus on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief item noting that ties to Epstein are slowing the confirmation path for a science office nominee.

persons.name: Eric Lander
persons.role: Nominee for Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy
persons.context: His nomination is reportedly delayed partly due to concerns about past meetings with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Maria Cantwell
persons.role: U.S. Senator, Chair of Senate Commerce Committee
persons.context: Reportedly has concerns about Eric Lander's meetings with Jeffrey Epstein, slowing his confirmation.

connections.description: Lander met with Epstein in 2012, which is causing concerns during his nomination process.

keyFacts: The document is a general FBI news briefing covering a vast array of topics from April 23, 2021, not a case-specific document.
Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned only once, in the context of his past association potentially impacting the confirmation of a Biden administration nominee, Eric Lander.
The briefing is a broad summary of national and international news, with the Epstein reference being a minor item among hundreds of others.
No new allegations, victims, or events related to the Epstein case are detailed in this document.
